content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm looking to get the best possible price for my property. I believe the market rate for a 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in this location is around 800-900 Euro per month. However, I'm open to negotiations and want to hear your offer. What do you think is a fair price for this apartment?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
What is the purpose of the "TERMINATE" message in the negotiation dialogue?

The "TERMINATE" message is used in the negotiation dialogue to indicate that the negotiation has been successful and that the parties have reached an agreement on the rental price. The message is used to terminate the negotiation process and signal that the parties are ready to move forward with the rental agreement.

The "TERMINATE" message is also used to indicate that the negotiation has not been successful and that the parties have not reached an agreement on the rental price. In this case, the message is used to terminate the negotiation process and signal that the parties are not interested in continuing the negotiation.

In either case, the "TERMINATE" message is an important part of the negotiation dialogue as it provides a clear and concise way to communicate the outcome of the negotiation and allows the parties to move forward with the rental agreement.
name: Max Müller from Germany
